item.description:
Hike time: 4:15pm (sunset 6:49pm)
Difficulty: Easy-to-moderate (mostly-flat dirt/gravel road, plus a short, somewhat steep trail hike up rocky Soapstone Hill)
Distance: 8 miles round-trip (including the hill)
Duration: 5 hours estimated (4 hiking...but we'll watch the sun set, too!)

 

NIGHT ACCESS PERMIT REQUIRED

You must call the Quabbin rangers ahead of time (phone # on permit) with your permit number, time of entry (4:15pm, but will be there well after sunset), and gate of entry (Gate 35). Please do not wait until you arrive; cell phone coverage is not consistent. Carry the business-card size permit with you and display the letter-size permit in your windshield.

 

Shoreline Hike to watch the sun set from Soapstone Hill

The road from Gate 35 takes a jaunt through the woods, then follows the shoreline for 2 miles before heading inland. After another 1+ mile, we take the trail up Soapstone Hill, from where we can watch the sun set!

Due to a mild winter and heavy spring rains, bushes grew tall here by summertime. They will block your view if you sit on the rocks, so you might want to bring a camp chair, unless you prefer to stand (or sit and look up at the stars).

It will be chilly and breezy at night, so dress in layers! Wear long sleeves and pants to protect against mosquitoes. Flashlight/headlamp and insect repellant are required!

 

IMPORTANT INFORMATION

Quabbin Regulations:

  • No swimming or wading. (Public drinking water supply.)
  • No animals. (Same reason.)
  • "Carry in, carry out." (Take your trash with you when you leave; no trash cans.)
  • Do not remove items from the reservation.
  • Do not block gates.
  • NIGHT ACCESS PERMIT REQUIRED. You must call ahead...see above.

What to bring:

  • "Deep-woods"-type insect repellant (high DEET, or Pemetherin) REQUIRED.
  • Flashlight or headlamp REQUIRED.
  • Night access permit REQUIRED (business-card and letter-size versions).
  • 1 liter or more of fluids.
  • Snacks.
  • Camera highly recommended (tripod if you will take dim light/long exposure photos).

 

DIRECTIONS

From the East, take 122 North, or from the South, take 37 or 37A North onto 122 North. "Old N Dana Rd" is several miles further on the left. It has a small, triangle-shaped island at the end. If you pass between North and South Spectacle ponds (water on both sides of the road, some marsh grasses on the south side), you have gone too far.

From the West or North, take 202 to 122 South. After you pass between North and South Spectacle ponds, look for "S Athol Rd" on your left. Slow down, because "Old N Dana Rd" is coming up on the right!

Gate 35 is at the end of Old N Dana Rd. Do not block the gate. Whoever gets there first, stay back a car length or two.

 

I can't check email daily. If you have a question, please comment at the bottom of this hike. This also benefits anyone who has the same question.

Please check the weather that day to decide what to wear. At this time of year, the temperature varies a LOT each day and day-to-night. If there is a chance of rain, do not wear cotton...hypothermia can occur below 50 degrees Farenheit.

Please check this meetup a few hours ahead in case of cancellation!
